docs.lead_paragraph: Survivors of flash floods that killed more than 900 people in the southern Philippines are now at risk of contracting disease, health officials said.

headline.seo: Philippine Flood Survivors Are at Risk
headline.main: In Philippines, Concern Grows Over Flood Survivors
headline.print_headline: In Philippines, Concern Grows Over Flood Survivors

docs.abstract: Death toll from flash floods in southern Philippines soars to more than 900 people, as health officials turn their attention to near 45,000 survivors packed into evacuation centers and threat of communicable diseases; they are organizing vaccinations to try to stem outbreaks.
docs.snippet: Survivors of flash floods that killed more than 900 people in the southern Philippines are now at risk of contracting disease, health officials said.

docs.lead_paragraph: New research indicating that Eva Perón was lobotomized not long before her death is a reminder of how enthusiastically this operation was once embraced.

headline.seo: Report on Eva Perón Recalls Time When Lobotomy Was Embraced
headline.main: When Lobotomy Was Seen as Advanced
headline.print_headline: When Lobotomy Was Seen as Advanced

docs.abstract: Dr Barron H Lerner reflects on new evidence that Eva Peron, the first lady of Argentina, underwent lobotomy for pain related to cervical cancer before her death in 1952; says discovery is sad example of inappropriate use of lobotomies, which were all too common in the 1950s.
docs.snippet: New research indicating that Eva Perón was lobotomized not long before her death is a reminder of how enthusiastically this operation was once embraced.

docs.lead_paragraph: Statins, among the most prescribed drugs for the prevention of cardiovascular disease, also appear to reduce the risk for death in patients hospitalized with the flu.

headline.main: Patterns: Statins May Reduce Risk of Death From Flu
headline.print_headline: Patterns: Statins May Reduce Risk of Death From Flu

docs.abstract: Study published in the The Journal of Infectious Diseases finds that statins, commonly prescribed for the prevention of cardiovascular disease, also appear to reduce the risk for death in patients hospitalized with the flu; study is co-authored by Dr Ann R Thomas of the Oregon Public Health Division.
docs.snippet: Statins, among the most prescribed drugs for the prevention of cardiovascular disease, also appear to reduce the risk for death in patients hospitalized with the flu.
